alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 10:47PM EDT until April 08 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Bush Kill At Shoemakers affecting Monroe County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bush Kill At Shoemakers. * WHEN...From Friday morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Route 209 in the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area floods. At 7.0 feet, Creek Road near Route 209 and Bushkill Road floods. Flooding increases on Route 209 and is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and crest at 6.1 feet. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.1 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Bush Kill Shoemakers 6.0 5.0 Thu 9 pm 5.3 4.4 6.1 8am 4/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 1045 AM EDT.
